solution_line_template: The second year, she quadrupled the number of statues in her front lawn, adding to the original {initial_statues} and bringing the total number to {initial_statues}*{quadruple}=<<{initial_statues}*{quadruple}={after_second_year}>>{after_second_year} statues.
In the third year, she added another {added_third_year} statues, bringing the total number to {after_second_year}+{added_third_year}={after_adding_third_year} statues.

But a hail storm broke {broken_third_year}, reducing the number to {after_adding_third_year}-{broken_third_year}=<<{after_adding_third_year}-{broken_third_year}={after_breaking_third_year}>>{after_breaking_third_year} statues.

In the fourth year, she added twice as many new statues as had been broken the year before, adding {multiplier_fourth_year}*{broken_third_year}=<<{multiplier_fourth_year}*{broken_third_year}={added_fourth_year}>>{added_fourth_year} statues.

Thus, the addition of these {added_fourth_year} statues brought the total number of statues to {after_breaking_third_year}+{added_fourth_year}=<<{after_breaking_third_year}+{added_fourth_year}={total_statues}>>{total_statues} statues.
